title: Is the Presence of Technology Improving Corporations and Increasing the Prosperity of Investors and Individuals?
descriptions:
Title: The Impact of Technology on Corporations, Investors, and Individuals: A Comprehensive Assessment

This grant proposal aims to investigate the multifaceted relationship between technology, corporations, investors, and individuals, focusing on communication, environmental and social (ES) issues, and compensation within the tech industry. The study, titled "Is the Presence of Technology Improving Corporations and Increasing the Prosperity of Investors and Individuals?", will explore three key areas:

1. Communication with shareholders: The project will examine whether the shift to virtual-only meetings has muted shareholders' voices at these events, potentially minimizing communication and enabling firms to avoid addressing shareholder questions strategically.

2. Environment and social issues: Utilizing natural language processing, the research will evaluate the disparity between firms' stated and actual actions on ES issues. Preliminary findings suggest that markets reward firms for stating actions promoting ES goals rather than for actual actions.

3. Compensation: The study will investigate the relation between employees' characteristics, the economic benefit compensation (EBC) they receive, and their ability to maximize EBC value. A specific focus will be placed on gender disparities in the tech industry, aiming to assess the impact on the economic landscape and individual welfare.

The outcomes of this project will contribute significantly to the understanding of technology's role in shaping corporate practices, investor behaviors, and individual prosperity. The findings will pave the way for evidence-based strategies to address emerging challenges and promote equitable growth in the tech industry.
